author: Ajay Joseph
title: Maharashtra: Billboard collapses onto vehicles in Thane's Kalyan amid heavy rain; Video goes viral (WATCH)
text:
Maharashtra: Billboard collapses onto vehicles in Thane's Kalyan amid heavy rain; Video goes viral (WATCH) The incident took place at around 10:18 am when the hoarding, situated above a busy road, suddenly fell onto the road. At the time, several people were standing underneath, and an auto rickshaw carrying passengers was passing by.
Ajay Joseph First Published Aug 2, 2024, 12:46 PM IST | Last Updated Aug 2, 2024, 12:46 PM IST Follow A large hoarding collapsed onto vehicles in the bustling Shahjanand Chowk area of Kalyan (West) on Friday (August 2), resulting in minor injuries to three individuals and massive damage to three vehicles. The incident took place at around 10:18 am when the hoarding, situated above a busy road, suddenly fell onto the road. At the time, several people were standing underneath, and an auto rickshaw carrying passengers was passing by.
Fortunately, most individuals managed to escape just before the collapse, with only minor scratches reported among the injuredâ€”one from the auto rickshaw and another passerby. The three vehicles affected by the collapse were left extensively damaged.
Death toll climbs to 33 as heavy rains devastate Uttarakhand, Himachal; Army joins rescue efforts (WATCH)
CCTV footage of the incident shows the immediate evacuation of people from the area as the hoarding fell. Emergency services, including Kalyan-Dombivli Municipal staff and fire brigade teams, quickly arrived on the scene to remove the debris and assess the damage.
Earlier, new safety regulations for hoardings were introduced, focusing on structural integrity. The updated guidelines mandate the use of perforated sheets for new signages to enhance safety during cyclones and set a maximum allowable lifespan of 50 years from the date of approval for hoardings.
Telangana SHOCKER! Fatal stray dog attack claims life of 82-year-old bedridden woman in Rajanna Sircilla
Existing hoardings are required to undergo a structural audit report every two years to ensure continued safety and compliance with the new standards.

title: Kinderimpfungen: RÃ¼ckgang bei Schutz vor tÃ¶dlichen Krankheiten
text:

Impfungen von Kindern zum Schutz vor potenziell tÃ¶dlichen Krankheiten sind einer Studie zufolge weltweit ins Stocken geraten. Mehrere GrÃ¼nde sind dafÃ¼r verantwortlich.
Impfungen von Kindern zum Schutz vor potenziell tÃ¶dlichen Krankheiten sind einer Studie zufolge weltweit ins Stocken geraten. GrÃ¼nde sind wirtschaftliche Ungleichheit, Unterbrechungen wÃ¤hrend der Corona-Pandemie, Desinformation und Impfskepsis, wie aus der am Mittwoch im Fachmagazin The Lancet verÃ¶ffentlichten Studie01037-2/abstract) hervorgeht. Damit seien Millionen Menschenleben gefÃ¤hrdet.
Durch die Entwicklungen erhÃ¶he sich die Gefahr kÃ¼nftiger AusbrÃ¼che vermeidbarer Krankheiten, warnten die Wissenschaftler. Gleichzeitig wÃ¼rden durch umfangreiche KÃ¼rzungen internationaler Hilfen bisherige Fortschritte bei der Impfung von Kindern in aller Welt gefÃ¤hrdet. FÃ¼r die Studie untersuchte ein internationales Team aus Forschern die Impfraten in mehr als 200 LÃ¤ndern zwischen 1980 und 2023.
154 Millionen Menschenleben gerettet
Die Studie verweist aber auch auf positive Entwicklungen. So habe ein Immunisierungsprogramm der Weltgesundheitsorganisation (WHO) in den vergangenen fÃ¼nfzig Jahren SchÃ¤tzungen zufolge rund 154 Millionen Menschenleben gerettet. Im Kampf gegen Krankheiten wie Diphtherie, Tetanus, Keuchhusten, Masern, Polio und Tuberkulose habe sich zudem die Impfquote zwischen 1980 und 2023 verdoppelt, fand das Wissenschaftlerteam heraus.
Allerdings verlangsamte sich der Anstieg in den 2010er-Jahren, als Impfungen zum Schutz vor Masern in rund der HÃ¤lfte der LÃ¤nder abnahmen. Der stÃ¤rkste RÃ¼ckgang wurde in Lateinamerika verzeichnet. In mehr als der HÃ¤lfte aller einkommensstarken LÃ¤nder ging unterdessen der Anteil der Kinder zurÃ¼ck, die zumindest eine Impfdosis gegen Diphtherie, Tetanus, Keuchhusten, Masern, Polio oder Tuberkulose bekamen.
Routineimpfungen brachen ein
Dann schlug die Corona-Pandemie zu: Wegen der Lockdowns und anderer MaÃŸnahmen brachen die Routineimpfungen ein. Dies fÃ¼hrte dazu, dass zwischen 2020 und 2023 die Zahl der Kinder, die nie eine Impfdosis erhielten, um weitere knapp dreizehn Millionen anstieg. Rund 15,6 Millionen Kinder haben nicht die aus drei Impfdosen bestehende komplette Impfung gegen Diphtherie, Tetanus, Keuchhusten oder Masern erhalten.
Die ungleiche Versorgung mit Impfungen hÃ¤lt der Studie zufolge weiter an, vor allem in Ã¤rmeren LÃ¤ndern. Von den 15,7 Millionen Kindern weltweit, die 2023 keinerlei Impfschutz hatten, lebte mehr als die HÃ¤lfte in nur acht LÃ¤ndern, die mehrheitlich sÃ¼dlich der Sahara in Afrika liegen.
Zehnmal mehr Masern-FÃ¤lle als 2023
In der EuropÃ¤ischen Union wurden im vergangenen Jahr zehnmal mehr Masern-FÃ¤lle gezÃ¤hlt als 2023. Bei einem Masern-Ausbruch in den USA wurden im vergangenen Monat mehr als tausend FÃ¤lle in 30 Bundesstaaten registriert. Das sind schon mehr FÃ¤lle als im Gesamtjahr 2024.
FÃ¤lle von KinderlÃ¤hmung, die in vielen Regionen lange Zeit als ausgerottet galt, nehmen in Pakistan und Afghanistan wieder zu. Papua-Neuguinea erlebt aktuell einen Polio-Ausbruch.
Â«Desinformation und ImpfskepsisÂ»
Â«Routineimpfungen in der Kindheit gehÃ¶ren zu den stÃ¤rksten und kosteneffektivsten Ã¶ffentlichen GesundheitsmaÃŸnahmen, die es gibtÂ», erklÃ¤rte Jonathan Mosser vom US-Institut fÃ¼r Gesundheitsmetriken und Evaluation (IHME), einer der leitenden Autoren der Studie. Anhaltende globale Ungleichheiten, Herausforderungen der Corona-Pandemie und die zunehmende Desinformation und Impfskepsis hÃ¤tten Â«zusammen dazu gefÃ¼hrt, dass der Immunisierungsprozess ins Stocken gerÃ¤tÂ», fÃ¼gte Mosser hinzu.
Die globale Gesundheitsversorgung steht zudem unter Druck, seitdem die US-Regierung von PrÃ¤sident Donald Trump ihre internationalen Hilfen drastisch gekÃ¼rzt hat.

author: Reuters
title: World Court to rule on jurisdiction in Russia-Ukraine genocide case | Law-Order
text: World Court to rule on jurisdiction in Russia-Ukraine genocide case Instead, it says Russia violated the genocide treaty by justifying the invasion by saying it was needed to stop an alleged genocide of Russian speakers in eastern Ukraine. In hearings in September last year, lawyers for Moscow urged judges to throw out the case, saying Kyiv's legal arguments were flawed and the court had no jurisdiction. [Reuters](/reuters-stories)| Updated: 02-02-2024 05:32 IST | Created: 02-02-2024 05:32 IST The United Nations' highest court will rule Friday if a case in which Ukraine has accused Russia of violating international law, by saying its invasion was launched to stop an alleged genocide, can move forward. Ukraine brought the case at the International Court of Justice (ICJ), also known as the World Court, days after Russia's invasion of Ukraine on Feb. 24, 2022. While the case revolves around the 1948 Genocide Convention, Kyiv does not accuse Moscow of committing genocide in Ukraine. Instead, it says Russia violated the genocide treaty by justifying the invasion by saying it was needed to stop an alleged genocide of Russian speakers in eastern Ukraine. In hearings in September last year, lawyers for Moscow urged judges to throw out the case, saying Kyiv's legal arguments were flawed and the court had no jurisdiction. Ukraine argued there was no risk of genocide in eastern Ukraine, where it had been fighting Russian-backed forces since 2014. Moscow has said Ukraine is using the case as a roundabout way to get a ruling on the overall legality of Russia's military action. More than two dozen European states, as well as Australia and Canada, have backed Kyiv by giving formal statements to the court, stressing they believe the case should move forward. The court has already issued emergency measures in March 2022 in this case ordering Russia to immediately halt its military operations in Ukraine. While the court's rulings are final and legally binding, it has no way to enforce them and some states, like Russia, have ignored their orders. If the ICJ does decide the Ukraine-Russia genocide case can move forward, it could take many months before the court will hear the full case. Earlier this week Ukraine had a small victory at the ICJ when the judges ruled Russia had violated U.N. treaties against the financing of terrorism and discrimination in a different case that dealt with incidents from 2014. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) AlÃ©m de possÃ­veis imprecisÃµes na descriÃ§Ã£o dos fatos, estÃ¡ confirmado que o acidente ocorreu. AtÃ© o fechamento desta nota, outros detalhes sobre o trÃ¡gico acontecimento nÃ£o foram divulgados.

O que aconteceu no acidente de motocicleta em Matanzas?
Uma jovem holandesa de 21 anos faleceu na madrugada de segunda-feira em um acidente de motocicleta na cidade de Matanzas. O condutor, um jovem cubano, estÃ¡ hospitalizado em estado crÃ­tico. Ambos estavam voltando de um evento de salsa e, segundo testemunhas, viajavam sem capacetes, discutindo e sob o efeito de Ã¡lcool, o que contribuiu para o desfecho trÃ¡gico.
Quais foram as causas do acidente em Matanzas?
O acidente foi causado por uma combinaÃ§Ã£o de fatores: excesso de velocidade, falta de capacetes de seguranÃ§a e estado emocional alterado devido a uma discussÃ£o e ao consumo de Ã¡lcool. Esses elementos levaram o casal a perder o controle da moto em uma curva perigosa em frente Ã  praia El Tenis.
Como estÃ¡ sendo gerida a seguranÃ§a viÃ¡ria em Cuba?
Apesar dos esforÃ§os para melhorar a seguranÃ§a viÃ¡ria, os acidentes de trÃ¢nsito continuam sendo frequentes em Cuba, muitas vezes devido Ã  negligÃªncia dos motoristas, ao mau estado das estradas e Ã  falta de manutenÃ§Ã£o dos veÃ­culos. O fator humano Ã© identificado como o principal responsÃ¡vel pelos acidentes, com 92% dos acidentes relacionados a erros humanos.
Quais medidas podem ser tomadas para evitar acidentes de motocicleta em Cuba?
O uso de capacetes de seguranÃ§a Ã© essencial para evitar lesÃµes graves em caso de acidentes. AlÃ©m disso, Ã© crucial evitar dirigir sob os efeitos do Ã¡lcool e respeitar os limites de velocidade. A educaÃ§Ã£o viÃ¡ria e o respeito pelas normas de trÃ¢nsito tambÃ©m sÃ£o fundamentais para melhorar a seguranÃ§a nas estradas cubanas.

author: Ravinder Kaur
title: Sonam Bajwa dazzles in Black Sequinned Dress
text: She chose statement black earrings. Punjabi cinemaâ€™s star, Sonam Bajwa, recently made a striking fashion statement, leaving her fans and followers in awe. She stepped into the spotlight, donning a glamorous black sequin dress that effortlessly combined sophistication and allure. Her The dress that Sonam Bajwa chose was a modern take on the classic sequin tube maxi dress. It was a perfect blend of contemporary style and timeless elegance, featuring delicate spaghetti straps and a dramatic back slit that added an element of surprise. This fashion-forward choice not only highlighted Sonamâ€™s impeccable taste but also ensured she was the centre of attention at any gathering. In true fashionista style, Sonam Bajwa paired her sequin dress with sleek pencil heels, adding an extra layer of sophistication to her look. The heels not only enhanced her stature but also perfectly complemented the dress, creating a harmonious ensemble. To accessorise, she chose statement black earrings that balanced the sparkle of the sequins, resulting in a well-coordinated and stylish look. One of the standout aspects of Sonam Bajwaâ€™s look was her minimalist [makeup](https://www.desiblitz.com/content/10-makeup-artist-approved-beauty-products-you-need-to-try). Choosing to let her natural beauty shine, she opted for a subtle palette of earthy tones and a dewy finish. This approach allowed her radiant smile and expressive eyes to take centre stage, captivating her audience. Adding the final touch to her ensemble, Sonam Bajwa let her hair flow freely down her shoulders. This effortless style added a sense of carefree glamour to her look, perfectly matching the chic and contemporary vibe of her sequin dress. Sonam Bajwaâ€™s latest fashion statement is a testament to her unique style and her ability to turn heads wherever she goes. Sonam Bajwa initially rose to fame through her roles in Punjabi movies, including Best Of Luck and Carry On Jatta 2. Her meteoric rise to stardom and her ever-increasing fan base have solidified her status as one of the most captivating and influential figures in the Indian entertainment industry. Fans eagerly anticipate Sonamâ€™s next project, the upcoming movie Ranna Ch Dhanna, in which she will share the screen with notable actors Diljit Dosanjh and [Shehnaaz Gill](https://www.desiblitz.com/content/shehnaaz-gill-dazzles-in-striking-white-thigh-high-slit-gown). With her charm, charisma, and unparalleled sense of style, Sonam Bajwa continues to sizzle in the limelight, leaving an indelible mark on the hearts of her admirers.
